intro: Bupleurum falcatum f. multicaule, commonly known as the multicaule bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, multi-stemmed growth habit and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal medicine.
